issue.title: EXCEPTION: 18NonFatalCheckError
issue.body:
I normaly would not submit a "corrupt block" error - however I received a pop-up dialog box that I'd never seen before and it recommended submitting...

<!-- This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to Bitcoin Core.



EXCEPTION: 18NonFatalCheckError       
Internal bug detected: 'm_wallet->chain().findBlock(m_wallet->GetLastBlockHash(), FoundBlock().time(block_time))'
wallet/interfaces.cpp:335 (tryGetTxStatus)
You may report this issue here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues
       
bitcoin in WalletModel->WalletModel       

Error: A fatal internal error occurred, see debug.log for details


<!-- What version of Bitcoin Core are you using, where did you get it (website, self-compiled, etc)? -->

23

<!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? -->

Ubuntu 22.04

Architecture:           x86_64
  CPU op-mode(s):       32-bit, 64-bit
  Address sizes:        36 bits physical, 48 bits virtual
  Byte Order:           Little Endian
CPU(s):                 4
  On-line CPU(s) list:  0-3
Vendor ID:              GenuineIntel
  Model name:           Intel(R) Core(TM) i5 CPU       M 450  @ 2.40GHz
    CPU family:         6
    Model:              37
    Thread(s) per core: 2
    Core(s) per socket: 2
    Socket(s):          1
    Stepping:           5
    Frequency boost:    enabled
    CPU max MHz:        2400.0000
    CPU min MHz:        1199.0000
    BogoMIPS:           4788.41
    Flags:              fpu vme de pse tsc msr pae mce cx8 apic sep mtrr pge mca
                         cmov pat pse36 clflush dts acpi mmx fxsr sse sse2 ht tm
                         pbe syscall nx rdtscp lm constant_tsc arch_perfmon pebs
                         bts rep_good nopl xtopology nonstop_tsc cpuid aperfmper
                        f pni dtes64 monitor ds_cpl est tm2 ssse3 cx16 xtpr pdcm
                         pcid sse4_1 sse4_2 popcnt lahf_lm pti ssbd ibrs ibpb st
                        ibp dtherm ida arat flush_l1d
Caches (sum of all):    
  L1d:                  64 KiB (2 instances)
  L1i:                  64 KiB (2 instances)
  L2:                   512 KiB (2 instances)
  L3:                   3 MiB (1 instance)
NUMA:                   
  NUMA node(s):         1
  NUMA node0 CPU(s):    0-3
Vulnerabilities:        
  Itlb multihit:        KVM: Mitigation: VMX unsupported
  L1tf:                 Mitigation; PTE Inversion
  Mds:                  Vulnerable: Clear CPU buffers attempted, no microcode; S
                        MT vulnerable
  Meltdown:             Mitigation; PTI
  Mmio stale data:      Not affected
  Retbleed:             Not affected
  Spec store bypass:    Mitigation; Speculative Store Bypass disabled via prctl 
                        and seccomp
  Spectre v1:           Mitigation; usercopy/swapgs barriers and __user pointer 
                        sanitization
  Spectre v2:           Mitigation; Retpolines, IBPB conditional, IBRS_FW, STIBP
                         conditional, RSB filling
  Srbds:                Not affected
  Tsx async abort:      Not affected

events.body:
>  2022-08-21T05:30:05Z *** Corrupt block found indicating potential hardware failure; shutting down

Bitcoin Core makes heavy use of CPU, RAM and disk IO. Hardware defects might only become visible when running Bitcoin Core. You might want to check your hardware for defects.

* memtest86 to check your RAM
* to check the CPU behaviour under load, use linpack or Prime95
* to test your storage device use smartctl or CrystalDiskInfo

Source: https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/a/12206
